SENIOR SALES ASSISTANT/ SALES SUPPORT             Skills    ads, attention to detail, customer service, data base, inventory, office, presentations, quality control, sales, phones      Experience      Senior Sales Assistant/ Sales Support  ,   01/2006   to   01/2012    Company Name   －   City  ,   State      Accurately monitored and evaluated ads for specifications and standards compliance.  Provided high standard of service and attention to detail.  Quickly and effectively solve customer challenges.  Maintain quality control/satisfaction records, constantly seeking 
    new ways to improve customer service.  Answered multi-line phones.  Maintained inventory of office supplies.  Managed all aspects of daily office operations.  Created and edited memos, correspondence and directory reports for management evaluations and presentations.          Box Office Manager  ,   01/2003   to   01/2006    Company Name   －   City  ,   State      Managed all aspects of ticket sales.  Maintained data base of all season ticket holders, answered   
     multi-line phones, and kept an inventory of all supplies.  Organized volunteers to work in the box office to help with 
     ticket sales for concerts.          Education and Training      High School Diploma  :    1985    Northwood High School   －   City  ,   State
personality:
Reading between the lines of this resume, I can deduce several personality traits:

1. Organized and Methodical
- Their repeated mention of monitoring, maintaining records, and attention to detail suggests someone who is naturally systematic
- They seem to appreciate structure and order

2. People-Oriented
- Their long tenure in customer-facing roles
- Focus on customer service improvement
- Experience managing volunteers shows leadership and interpersonal skills

3. Reliable and Stable
- Long-term employment histories (6 years and 3 years) suggest loyalty and dependability
- Consistent focus on maintaining standards and quality

4. Proactive
- "Constantly seeking new ways to improve customer service" indicates initiative
- Self-motivated to solve problems

5. Professional and Mature
- Writing style and career progression suggests someone who takes their work seriously
- High school graduation in 1985 indicates an experienced professional

6. Detail-Focused but Big Picture Aware
- Balances specific tasks (inventory, phones) with broader responsibilities ("all aspects of daily operations")
- Shows understanding of both tactical and strategic elements of their roles

Overall, this seems to be someone who is responsible, stable, and service-oriented, with strong organizational skills and a professional demeanor.
